key_points: Meghan Markle and Prince Harry visited Melba's Harlem restaurant after Meghan's book reading at PS 123.
Restaurateur Melba Wilson described the couple as 'extremely gracious' and 'down-to-earth'.
Wilson was informed about the royal visit an hour prior and was instructed not to close the restaurant for a private visit.
The couple sampled various Southern staples and contemporary dishes from the restaurant's menu.
Harry and Meghan expressed a desire to mingle with other customers and were engaging with staff and patrons.
Their approachability and genuine care left a lasting positive impression on Wilson.
The Duke and Duchess of Sussex donated $25,000 to Melba's COVID-19 Employee Relief Fund via the Archewell Foundation.
Wilson emphasized the significance of the donation in supporting her employees and others facing food insecurity during the pandemic.
The visit is seen as a show of support not just for a Black, female-owned business but for the Harlem community and small communities in general.
Wilson feels fulfilled by giving back and is inspired by the royal couple's visit and support.
